newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine Catamarca mine tender seen as benchmark.
newsitem.headline: Argentine Catamarca mine tender seen as benchmark.

text.p: Results of an Argentine mine exploration tender due Friday may help set a benchmark for Catamarca province's mining negotiations, the provincial mining secretary said Wednesday.
"I'm awaiting the tender with interest, as it may serve for terms of reference in agreeing future deals," Raul Galarza told Reuters by telephone.
Argentine firm Yacimientos Mineros Aguas de Dionisio (YMAD) said earlier Wednesday that it would soon announce the winner of the tender, which has already drawn three bids of about $20 million.
Galarza said that the three bidders had each offered about $2 million cash to YMAD as part of their proposals.
Catamarca province has already agreed on terms for exploration rights with Canada's Northern Orion Explorations Ltd for the Antofalla Este gold, copper and silver prospect.
"I think that in 30 days we will have issued the final decree for Antofalla Este so that they can begin work at the site this summer," Galarza said.
Catamarca is also negotiating with Northern Orion over the La Hoyada and Diablillos prospects, and with Australia's BHP Ltd over the Filo Colorado prospect.
Galarza said he expected talks over Filo Colorado to be concluded first, followed by La Hoyada and then Diablillos.

Bidders to explore YMAD's 230-square km site in the northwestern province of Catamarca were MRN Explorations SA, Le Source Development Argentina IATE and Eastcan Mining Ltd. Each proposed spending about $20 million in exploration.

MRN is a joint-venture between MIM Holdings Ltd, Australia's North Ltd and Rio Algom Ltd of Canada. These three companies are already partners in the billion-dollar Bajo de la Alumbrera copper and gold project, adjacent to the property now being tendered.
Le Source is made up by Australia's Normandy Mining and French company BRGM. Eastcan is from Canada.
